page.title: 03Lowland areas near Coniston
page.content: {LOWLAND}As well as Coniston village, the lowland area surrounding the head of Coniston Water consists of a mosaic of farmland and woodland. The{farmland is all intensively managed{grassland, the in-bye land of local farms. Usually these small fields are conserved for{hay and silage.}Also they are grazed by sheep and cattle. There are many blocks of{woodland; mainly{oak,}with{ash, sycamore, birch, {willow}and{hazel}as the most prominent species. One or two woods are small coniferous plantations. Some of the woodland, particularly that at Coniston Hall and Park Coppice, is used for{caravan sites.}Networks of rough roads thread through the trees, which effectively conceal the caravans from view.
